title: Majlis al-Nuwwab
text:
Majlis al-Nuwwab (), literally "Assembly of Deputies", is used in a number of countries as the Arabic-language name for the <a href="Lower%20house">lower, directly elected house of a bicameral legislature</a>. As a closer parallel to the idea of <a href="representative%20democracy">representative democracy</a>, it is usually contrasted against the <a href="Tradition%20of%20Majlis%20al%20Shura">Tradition of Majlis al Shura</a> ("council of consultants", usually more associated with non-legislative assemblies of advisors to a ruler or, more recently, the <a href="upper%20house">upper house</a>s of bicameral parliaments). 
The word is used as the official name of the following:
